member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.InitialiseFsLogging(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary:
Be sure to set the correct config in the appsettings.json
Example:
"LogSettings": {
"Directory": "\\\\ACCEPT01\\Data\\FS\\Logs\\[appName]",
"ApplicationName": "[appName]",
"Endpoint": "[log service baseURl]"
},

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsUseAudit(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary:
Creates an audit log for every request
IMPORTANT: add this middleware after authorization/authentication!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsUseAudit(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,LogManager.Model.Audit.ExcludedRout)
member.summary:
Creates an audit log for every request except the excluded rout
IMPORTANT: add this middleware after authorization/authentication!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsUseAudit(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,System.Collections.Generic.List{LogManager.Model.Audit.ExcludedRout})
member.summary:
Creates an audit log for every request except the excluded routs
IMPORTANT: add this middleware after authorization/authentication!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsUseAudit(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,LogManager.Model.Audit.IncludedRout)
member.summary:
Creates an audit log only for the given rout
IMPORTANT: add this middleware after authorization/authentication!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsUseAudit(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,System.Collections.Generic.List{LogManager.Model.Audit.IncludedRout})
member.summary:
Creates an audit log only for the given routs
IMPORTANT: add this middleware after authorization/authentication!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsMonitorSuspiciousCalls(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder)
member.summary:
Catches responses with the satusCodes 401, 403 and 404. these request will be logged
401: Unauthorized
403: Forbidden
404: NotFound
IMPORTANT: add this middleware before authorization/authentication!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsMonitorSuspiciousCalls(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Catches responses with the given satusCodes and logs the request
IMPORTANT: add this middleware after authorization/authentication!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware

member.name: M:LogManager.DepencendyInjector.FsExceptionHandler(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IApplicationBuilder,System.Func{System.Exception,LogManager.Model.Exception.ResponseMessage})
member.summary:
This middleware will handle the exceptions, if no custom exceptions are added the exception will be send to the loggin service as an ERROR.
IMPORTANT: add this middleware as last, after FsMonitorSuspiciousCalls, FsUseAuth and FsUseAudit!
Be sure to call the InitialiseFsLogging in the ConfigureServices function before using this audit middleware
member.param: function to handle the custom exceptions of your application. Return NULL in this function for default handeling

member.name: P:LogManager.Model.Audit.Rout.Method
member.summary:
The HTTP method
System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.[verb]

member.name: P:LogManager.Model.Audit.Rout.Path
member.summary:
The path after the base URL (don't use a / at the start).
For specifying an action use [controller]/[action]
For specifying an whole controller use [controller]
